page.title: 16ROAD RACING ON KING'S PARADE
page.content: Every so often the roads known as"King's Parade"which encircle the Dips are closed to normal road traffic.Wooden fencing springs up creating paddocks and barricades to control spectators and competitors at the New Brighton Road Races. The roads and roundabouts are edged with straw bales to protect drivers who come from all over the country to compete.They provide a free spectacular for thousands of local inhabitants who gather to watch them negotiating the sharp bens of a small but demanding course. The normally quiet atmosphere of the Dips is shattered by the roar of powerful engines which can also be heard all over Wallasey, and the soft sea air is mixed with the accrid smell of high octane fuel.
